Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2018 05:09AM Doofuscat wrote: if you have left breast sided cancer, proton therapy is the way to go. It doesn’t penetrate as deeply as traditional radiation thereby sparing more normal tissue. I wanted that for my treatment but my insurance company (UHC) considers it experimental despite its use for many years. They also turned me down for intraoperative radiation which I was a perfect candidate for. We are being held hostage by our insurance plans!!
Posts.Title: A rad onc weighs in on radiation "burns" Spinnerpom 53nancy
